text.section:
In establishing a tax credit under subsection (a)(3) through (5) of this section, the governing body of Howard County:
shall develop criteria necessary to implement the credit;
shall designate an agency to administer the credit; and
may specify:
the amount and duration of the credit;
the qualifications and application procedures for the credit; and
any other requirement or procedure for the granting or administration of the credit that the governing body considers appropriate.

section.section: A property tax credit under subsection (a)(3) of this section may not exceed the amount of county property tax imposed on the increase in assessment that is due to the new construction or improvements made to the property of the person applying for the credit.

If a property tax credit under subsection (a)(3) of this section is granted for property leased or rented by a commercial or industrial business allowed under this subsection:
the amount of the tax credit allowed shall pass through to the commercial or industrial business that conducts the activity that qualifies for the credit; and
the term of the tax credit may not exceed the term of the lease and may not exceed 10 years.
